hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on exploring purpose.\
We’ll be doing several rounds of reflection around a time when we felt purpose, and then sharing what we experienced.\
Heads up that you’ll need pen and paper.
hostNotes.asyncText:
Welcome, this session is about exploring purpose.

There will be several rounds of reflection around a time when we felt purpose, and then sharing what we experienced. You’ll need a pen and paper for this exercise.

hostNotes.text:
Before we get going, let’s just ground ourselves in the here and now with three cycles of breathing.

> Inhale and exhale slowly x 3
hostNotes.asyncText:
Before we get started, let’s get grounded here and now with three cycles of breathing.

> Inhale and exhale slowly x 3

Let’s get started.

hostNotes.text:
Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

Everyone feels lost at some point.

This can often show up when we’re faced with uncertainty, go through a key transition or realize that the things we do just don’t feel so meaningful anymore.
Realizing that our life could be different can be uncomfortable at first. We are naturally hard-wired to stick to what’s familiar, which makes it hard to make the leap.
But feeling lost can also motivate us to act differently. After all, if everything was fine, there would be no need to change.

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

Think back to a time in your life when you’ve felt a sense of meaning and purpose. One example could be a time when you were working towards something that really mattered to you.
hostNotes.asyncText:
Take 1 minute to reflect.

Think back to a time in your life when you’ve felt a sense of meaning and purpose. One example could be a time when you were working towards something that really mattered to you.

hostNotes.text: Recall a snapshot from that time. What was the situation? Where were you? Was anyone with you?
hostNotes.asyncText: Recall a snapshot from that time. What was the situation? Where were you? Was anyone with you?

hostNotes.text:
Take notes on a piece of paper. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.
hostNotes.asyncText:
Take notes on a piece of paper. There is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own.

> Press play to start the timer.

content.heading: Recall feeling purpose
content.text: What situation? Where? Anyone with you?

hostNotes.text:
Great. Now we’ll do another round of private reflections.\
Note down your thoughts, feelings and actions from that time you’ve felt a sense of meaning of purpose. What did you feel? What did you think? What did you do?
hostNotes.asyncText:
Take another minute to reflect.\
Note down your thoughts, feelings and actions from that time you’ve felt a sense of meaning of purpose.

hostNotes.text:
1 minute starting now.

`Press play to start the timer.`

That’s 1 minute and it’s time for next step.
hostNotes.asyncText:
What did you feel? \
What did you think? \
What did you do? 

> Press play to start the timer.

hostNotes.text: Now take a moment to explore your thoughts, feelings and actions today. What do you feel? What do you think? What do you do?
hostNotes.asyncText: Now take a moment to explore your thoughts, feelings and actions today. What do you feel? What do you think? What do you do?

hostNotes.text: Is there a difference between today and that other time? If so, what does it tell you?
hostNotes.asyncText:
Is there a difference between today and that other time?\
If so, what does it tell you?

> Press play to start the timer.

hostNotes.text:
Take notes on your paper. \
1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.heading: What do you feel, think and do today?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.\
The sharing question is how you feel, think and act today, comparing it with the time when you felt purpose.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

content.heading: What do you feel, think and do today?
content.text: Difference from that time feeling purpose?

hostNotes.text:
Our emotions can be a window into what matters to us in life.\
When we connect to what gives us a sense of meaning and purpose, we experience life differently than when we are on autopilot.
hostNotes.asyncText:
Our emotions can be a window into what matters to us in life.\
When we connect to what gives us a sense of meaning and purpose, we experience life differently than when we are on autopilot.

hostNotes.text:
This helps us to show up for and act on what truly matters.

Well done. If you’re up for a mission, take a moment each day for three days to notice where you are, how you feel, think and act, and see if it connects to your sense of purpose.
hostNotes.asyncText:
This helps us to show up for and act on what truly matters.

Well done. If you’re up for a mission, take a moment each day for three days to notice where you are, how you feel, think and act, and see if it connects to your sense of purpose.

hostNotes.text:
Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.
hostNotes.asyncText:
Before leaving this space, again take three rounds of mindful breathing.

> Inhale & exhale slowly x 3.

When you’re ready, finish the session at your own pace.

hostNotes.text:
Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

en.name: Feeling purpose

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

en.description: In this exercise we’ll explore what it means to feel purpose in life. Having a sense of purpose is related to happiness and life satisfaction.

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

xxMain question

xxFurther explanations of main question if needed

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

Well done. if you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.
